Go from taxon names from a character vector, a phylo object or a newick character string to a datelifeQuery object

Source: R/datelife_query.R
make_datelife_query.Rd

Go from taxon names from a character vector, a phylo object or a newick character string to a datelifeQuery object

Usage

make_datelife_query(
  input = c("Rhea americana", "Pterocnemia pennata", "Struthio camelus"),
  use_tnrs = TRUE,
  get_spp_from_taxon = FALSE
)

Arguments

input

Taxon names as one of the following:

A character vector

With taxon names as a single comma separated strting or concatenated with c().

A phylogenetic tree with taxon names as tip labels

As a phylo or multiPhylo object, OR as a newick character string.

use_tnrs

Whether to use OpenTree's Taxonomic Name Resolution Service (TNRS) to process input taxon names. Default to TRUE, it corrects misspellings and taxonomic name variations.

get_spp_from_taxon

Wether to search ages for all species belonging to a given taxon or not. Default to FALSE. If TRUE, it must have same length as input. If input is a newick string with some clades it will be converted to a phylo object, and the order of get_spp_from_taxon will match phy$tip.label.

Value

A datelifeQuery object, which is a list of three elements:

$phy

A phylo object or NA, if input is not a tree.

$cleaned_names

A character vector of cleaned taxon names.

$ott_ids

A numeric vector of OTT ids if use_tnrs = TRUE, or NULL if use_tnrs = FALSE.

Details

It processes phylo objects and newick character string inputs with input_process(). If input is a multiPhylo object, only the first phylo element will be used. Similarly, if an input newick character string has mutiple trees, only the first one will be used.

On this page

Developed by Brian O’Meara, Jonathan Eastman, Tracy Heath, April Wright, Klaus Schliep, Scott Chamberlain, Peter Midford, Luke Harmon, Joseph Brown, Matt Pennell, Mike Alfaro, Luna L. Sanchez Reyes.
